symptoms.name: Polyarthritis
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Symmetrical, involving peripheral joints (knees, ankles, wrists, fingers, metacarpophalangeal joints)

symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.pattern: Maculopapular, primarily on limbs and trunk; purpuric and vesicular rashes less common

risk_factors: Travel to endemic areas (Australia, Papua New Guinea, South Pacific Islands)
Living in tropical areas with standing water

required: Clinical presentation consistent with Ross River virus disease (polyarthritis, fever, rash, fatigue)
Positive paired serology (two blood tests taken two weeks apart, showing a rise in antibody levels)
supportive: Epidemiological evidence of outbreak in the area

differential_diagnoses: Other arboviral diseases (e.g., Barmah Forest virus, dengue, chikungunya, Zika virus)
Non-arboviral diseases (e.g., adenoviral, enteroviral, rickettsial infections)
